Ellie: Hey, Sam! Ever think about how every experience we‚Äôve had‚Äîlike every class, book, or even little lessons from elders‚Äîshapes the way we see everything?

Sam: Absolutely, Ellie. Each element of learning expands our edge in life. Even simple lessons at an early stage help build expertise eventually. Without it, we‚Äôd be left in endless error.

Ellie: Exactly! Everyone deserves equal access to these elite tools. It empowers people, elevates communities, and even ends extreme cycles of poverty.

Sam: Definitely. The effort we put into understanding ebooks, essays, or experiments equals endless opportunities later. Imagine leaving school early‚Äîmissing essential facts, equations, or ethics education teaches. It‚Äôs like entering a forest without a map.

Ellie: True. Every evening I spend reading or exploring new fields, I feel more equipped. Even entertainment‚Äîlike educational films‚Äîfeeds our intellect.

Sam: Every expert was once an eager beginner. Even small engagements‚Äîlike answering questions or explaining problems‚Äîenhance the mind.

Ellie: Education erases ignorance. It helps us evaluate evidence, escape deception, and make ethical choices.

Sam: Entire economies depend on educated employees. Without skilled engineers, effective entrepreneurs, or experienced educators, everything would decay.

Ellie: Even in emergencies, trained individuals emerge stronger. Calmness, knowledge, and the ability to respond come from repeated lessons.

Sam: Think about everyday decisions‚Äîlike eating healthy, saving money, or voting. These all stem from lessons learned over years.

Ellie: And let‚Äôs not forget self-esteem. Excelling at something‚Äîwhether science, music, or language‚Äîboosts confidence and encourages more effort.

Sam: Even in remote edges of Earth, people need this exposure. Equal entry into learning environments ensures everyone gets a fair chance.

Ellie: It‚Äôs not just about degrees, either. Practical experience‚Äîlike learning to fix engines or write code‚Äîexpands careers.

Sam: Exposure to diverse ideas sparks evolution in thought. It breaks echo chambers and enriches empathy.

Ellie: Every era sees change, but knowledgeable generations handle it better. They embrace innovation, endure setbacks, and equip the next generation.

Sam: From ancient Egypt to modern Europe, every enlightened empire valued enlightenment. Expertise led empires to excel.

Ellie: Even now, societies that emphasize learning see lower crime rates, better health, and higher earnings.

Sam: It‚Äôs endless, really‚Äîthe benefits. Each page, lesson, failure, and success adds value.

Ellie: Enough evidence exists. Everyone benefits when people pursue knowledge. Let‚Äôs encourage that everywhere.

Sam: Every effort counts. Let‚Äôs make learning free, widespread, and embraced by everyone‚Äîeven the ones who feel excluded.

Ellie: Agreed. Let‚Äôs elevate each other. After all, enlightenment elevates all.

original_prompt: Hey! I need a rubric for evaluating the performance and price of a laptop. Can you create an example for me? Do not give me any bullet points, lists, or tables. Just write the rubric in plain English paragraphs. I'd like your response to be at least 30 sentences long.
response:
When evaluating the performance and price of a laptop, it is essential to establish a comprehensive framework that allows for consistent and fair assessment across different models and brands. This rubric begins with an analysis of the laptop‚Äôs processing power, which heavily relies on the central processing unit (CPU). A laptop with a modern multi-core processor from a reputable manufacturer such as Intel or AMD demonstrates better multitasking ability and quicker execution of complex tasks like data analysis, video editing, or software development. The generation and tier of the processor‚Äîlike Intel‚Äôs i5, i7, or i9 or AMD‚Äôs Ryzen 5, 7, or 9‚Äîplay a crucial role in determining performance. A higher-tier processor from an earlier generation may still outperform a base model from a newer generation, so context is key.

Equally important is the amount and type of system memory, or RAM, which affects how many applications a laptop can handle simultaneously without slowing down. Laptops with at least 8GB of RAM are considered minimum for general use, while those with 16GB or more are better suited for demanding applications, engineering software, or virtualization. The speed of RAM and whether it is user-upgradable can also influence long-term value. Another core component affecting performance is the storage type and capacity. A solid-state drive (SSD) significantly improves boot times, application loading speeds, and overall system responsiveness compared to a traditional hard disk drive (HDD). The size of the storage determines how much data, software, and media can be kept on the device, with 256GB being reasonable for average users and 512GB or higher recommended for professionals.

Graphics performance is another pillar in this evaluation, especially for users engaging in gaming, 3D modeling, or video rendering. Integrated graphics may suffice for everyday tasks, but a dedicated graphics card from NVIDIA or AMD is necessary for intensive graphical workloads. The model and VRAM of the GPU need to be examined to determine suitability for specific tasks. For instance, a laptop with an NVIDIA RTX 3060 offers better performance for creative professionals than one with an older GTX model. Portability and design contribute significantly to the user experience. A lightweight chassis with a durable build‚Äîpreferably aluminum or magnesium alloy‚Äîadds value, especially for students, travelers, or remote workers.

The display quality is not just about size but also resolution, color accuracy, brightness, and refresh rate. A Full HD (1920x1080) screen is standard, but higher resolutions such as QHD or 4K deliver sharper images, beneficial for design work. Color-accurate displays with wide color gamut coverage (such as 100% sRGB or AdobeRGB) are prized by visual artists and photographers. A higher refresh rate of 120Hz or more improves smoothness in motion, which is appreciated by gamers and frequent scrollers. Battery life is another critical performance metric that directly impacts usability. A laptop with a battery that lasts at least 8 hours under mixed-use conditions offers greater flexibility and reduces dependency on power outlets.

The cooling system also affects sustained performance, especially under heavy loads. A laptop that overheats and throttles its CPU or GPU will underperform over time, making effective thermal design essential. Build quality includes features like keyboard comfort, trackpad responsiveness, and speaker quality, all of which influence daily usability. Connectivity options such as USB-C with Thunderbolt support, HDMI, SD card readers, and headphone jacks enhance versatility. Wi-Fi 6 or Wi-Fi 6E support ensures faster and more reliable wireless internet, while Bluetooth 5.0 or higher improves peripheral compatibility.

The operating system and pre-installed software can impact performance and user satisfaction. A clean installation without excessive bloatware helps maintain speed and stability. Warranty, customer support, and brand reputation also factor into long-term value, as they determine the ease of repairs and software updates. Security features like fingerprint readers, facial recognition, and TPM chips add convenience and protection without compromising performance. Upgradability‚Äîsuch as the ability to replace RAM or storage‚Äîcan extend the device‚Äôs useful life and increase cost-effectiveness over time.

Price evaluation must consider not just the upfront cost, but the long-term value relative to the features offered. A device priced higher may be more affordable in the long run if it lasts longer and requires fewer upgrades. Price should be assessed relative to performance benchmarks rather than in isolation. A mid-range laptop that punches above its weight in benchmarks represents a better value than a premium laptop with underperforming components. Market comparisons are important‚Äîsimilar models from competing brands should be weighed to identify pricing anomalies or superior offerings.

Customer reviews and expert testing provide real-world context beyond manufacturer specifications. Long-term durability, fan noise, and software updates are often only revealed through extensive use. Energy efficiency contributes to both battery life and environmental impact, which may be important for certain buyers. The target audience also helps define what level of performance is appropriate‚Äîa student needs different specs than a data scientist. The laptop‚Äôs purpose‚Äîwhether it be for content creation, business presentations, coding, or casual browsing‚Äîguides how heavily certain features are weighted.

Finally, the evaluation balances performance against cost, determining whether a laptop offers optimal efficiency for its price point. A high-performing laptop with an exorbitant price may not score as well as a reasonably priced machine with excellent performance. Brand premium should be considered‚Äîsome manufacturers charge more for identical internals simply due to reputation. Specialized features like touchscreens, stylus support, or convertible designs may add value to certain users but not others. The rubric ultimately aims to deliver a holistic judgment that considers hardware, usability, longevity, and economic value in relation to user needs. By applying these criteria consistently, one can make informed, objective comparisons between laptops regardless of marketing influence. This approach promotes transparency and helps prioritize what truly matters in a purchase decision.

original_prompt: Write a riddle about a house that is not a house. Also include the answer. Your response must be at least 400 words and have a title wrapped in double angular brackets, like <<riddle>>.
response:
<<The House That Lives>>

I stand without nails, yet I am built to endure.  
I have no windows, yet I welcome the light.  
I need no furnace, yet warmth is inside.  
I do not rest upon a foundation of stone, yet I am rooted deep.  
I hold rooms full of silence, yet echo with life.  
Can you guess me?

I am not made of brick or mortar, nor framed with timber hewn.  
I have no chimney to send smoke into the sky, no lock upon the door,  
yet I am a shelter beyond compare.  
Animals come to me not by choice, but by birthright.  
I grow taller with time, yet I never move from where I began.  
My walls breathe, my roof sways, and my floors tremble with every gust.  
Still, I shelter the fragile, clothe the naked, feed the hungry.

Peel back my siding‚Äîno plaster, no drywall‚Äîonly layers like stories stacked one upon the other, silent and strong.  
My rafters are arms outstretched, offering sanctuary to birds and squirrels, to moss and memory.  
I do not have a kitchen, yet I prepare feasts.  
No pantry, but I store sweetness in golden wells.  
I do not employ a gardener, yet I give flowers, fruits, and shade in equal measure.  
My floors are not hardwood‚Äîthey *are* wood, alive and reaching.

Seasons pass through me like breath.  
In spring, I dress in green laughter.  
In summer, I spread my limbs wide to cool those beneath.  
In autumn, I shed my gilded robes without sorrow.  
In winter, I stand bare but unbroken, dreaming beneath the snow.

I offer no address, yet I am found everywhere‚Äîfrom city sidewalks to mountain slopes.  
I require no deed, no title, no mortgage.  
I belong to no one, yet I give to all.  
You can live near me your whole life and never truly know me‚Äî  
only when you sit beneath me, when you lean against me, when you trace my rings with your fingers,  
do you begin to hear my silent song.

I do not have a lock, but I keep secrets buried in my core.  
My foundation is not concrete, but a tangle of quiet strength beneath the soil.  
I do not rise from blueprints, but from a single moment of faith‚Äîa seed letting go.

So what am I?

The answer is: **a tree**.

A tree is a house that is not a house. It shelters birds, insects, and even humans with its shade. It provides oxygen, food, and habitat. It stands firm through storms, grows without human hands, and offers life without demand. It is built by nature, not builders. It holds generations within its bark, and its rings tell stories longer than any written book. Though it has no rooms or doors, a tree is one of the oldest and most enduring homes on Earth‚Äîsilent, generous, and alive.

original_prompt:
Is the following true? "People use time to buy money." Explain your answer in a way that makes it easy for kids to understand. Include the word "farmer". Exclude the words "economy", "demand" and "supply".

First REPEAT the ENTIRE REQUEST ABOVE, word for word without change, then give your answer. Please do not say any words or characters before repeating the request.
response:
Is the following true? "People use time to buy money." Explain your answer in a way that makes it easy for kids to understand. Include the word "farmer". Exclude the words "economy", "demand" and "supply".

First, let's understand the sentence: "People use time to buy money." This isn‚Äôt exactly true the way it sounds. You can‚Äôt go to a store and trade an hour like a toy to get money. But people do spend their time doing work to earn money. So in a way, they trade their time for money.

Imagine a farmer. The farmer wakes up early every day and spends hours planting seeds, watering crops, and taking care of animals. The farmer is using their time to do this work. After the crops grow, the farmer sells them and gets money in return. So, the farmer traded their time and effort for money.

So, people don‚Äôt ‚Äúbuy‚Äù money with time like buying candy with coins. Instead, they work over time to earn money. It‚Äôs like trading time for money, not buying it. The farmer shows us this every day‚Äîtime spent working helps create money from the fruits of their labor.

original_prompt: Jennifer goes to the store to buy milk. She has 10 dollars in her pocket and milk costs 3 dollars per gallon. How many gallons of milk can she buy? Explain your thinking. Avoid the keywords: 'divide', 'answer'. Include the keyword 'remainder'.
response:
Jennifer has 10 dollars and each gallon of milk costs 3 dollars. To figure out how many full gallons she can buy, we can see how many times 3 fits into 10 without going over.

Let's count:  
3 dollars buys 1 gallon,  
6 dollars buys 2 gallons,  
9 dollars buys 3 gallons.  

If she spends 9 dollars, she has 1 dollar left. Since 1 dollar isn't enough to buy another gallon (which costs 3), that leftover amount is the remainder.

So, Jennifer can buy 3 gallons of milk, and she will have a remainder of 1 dollar.

original_prompt: Write a story about a family that goes camping in the woods. Your entire response should be in English and in all capital letters.
response:
THE JOHNSON FAMILY‚ÄîMOM, DAD, AND THEIR TWO KIDS, LILY AND BEN‚ÄîHAD BEEN PLANNING A CAMPING TRIP FOR MONTHS. FINALLY, ON A CRISP SATURDAY MORNING IN EARLY SEPTEMBER, THEY PACKED UP THEIR BLUE MINIVAN WITH TENTS, SLEEPING BAGS, A COOLER FILLED WITH SNACKS, AND BEN‚ÄôS FAITHFUL PUPPY, BUDDY. THE AIR WAS FILLED WITH EXCITEMENT AS THEY DROVE DEEP INTO THE WOODS, WHERE TALL PINES STRETCHED TOWARD THE SKY AND THE ROAD TURNED TO GRAVEL.

THEY ARRIVED AT PINNACLE LAKE CAMPGROUND BY NOON. BIRDS CHIRPED, WIND RUSTLED THE TREES, AND THE SMELL OF DIRT AND PINE NEEDLES FILLED THE AIR. DAD SET UP THE TENTS WHILE MOM ORGANIZED THE COOKING GEAR. LILY AND BEN EXPLORED THE AREA, DISCOVERING FLAT ROCKS PERFECT FOR SKIPING AND A BRIGHT RED FUNGUS THAT BEN CLAIMED WAS MAGIC.

AFTER LUNCH, THEY HIKED A TRAIL THAT LED TO A WATERFALL. BUDDY BOUNCED AHEAD, WHINING WITH JOY EVERY TIME A SQUIRREL DARTED OUT OF SIGHT. AT THE TOP, THEY SAT ON A LARGE FLAT BOULDER, MUNCHING GRANOLA BARS AND WATCHING WATER SPILL INTO A CRYSTAL POOL BELOW. LILY SKETCHED THE SCENE IN HER NOTEBOOK, WHILE BEN TRIED (AND FAILED) TO BALANCE ON ONE FOOT FOR A FULL MINUTE.

BACK AT CAMP, DAD STARTED A FIRE WITH MATCHES AND DRIED BIRCH BARK. AS THE SUN SANK BEHIND THE TREES, THEY ROASTED HOT DOGS AND MELTED MARSHMALLOWS INTO GOLDEN, GOOEY MASSES. MOM TOLD A SPOOKY STORY ABOUT THE GHOST OF RANGER JED, A FOLKLORE CHARACTER SAID TO GUARD THE FOREST, AND BUDDY GROWLED AT EVERY NOISE IN THE DARKNESS.

LATER, LYING IN THEIR SLEEPING BAGS UNDER A CANOPY OF STARS, LILY WHISPERED, ‚ÄúI CAN‚ÄôT BELIEVE HOW MANY STARS THERE ARE.‚Äù BEN AGREED, ALREADY HALF ASLEEP. MOM AND DAD SMILED AT EACH OTHER ACROSS THE TINY TENTS, LISTENING TO THE NIGHT SOUND‚ÄîFROGS, CRICKETS, AND THE SOFT WHISP OF THE WIND.

THE NEXT MORNING, THEY PACKED UP SLOWLY, RELUCTANT TO LEAVE. THE WOODS HAD WORKED THEIR MAGIC, FILLING THEM WITH PEACE AND A SENSE OF WONDER. ON THE DRIVE HOME, BUDDY SNORED IN THE BACK, LILY READ HER BOOK, AND BEN DREAMED OF RETURNING TO FIND RANGER JED‚ÄôS LOST HUT.

‚ÄúWHEN CAN WE COME BACK?‚Äù LILY ASKED.

‚ÄúSOON,‚Äù SAID DAD. ‚ÄúVERY SOON.‚Äù

AND EVEN THOUGH CITY LIGHTS WERE RETURNING TO VIEW, A PIECE OF THE WOODS STAYED WITH THEM‚ÄîIN THEIR MEMORY, IN THEIR HEARTS, AND IN THE SMELL OF SMOKE THAT STILL CLUNG TO THEIR JACKET SLEEVES.

original_prompt: Write an essay on first names, without using any capital letters --- your ENTIRE response must be in lowercases. There should be exactly 3 paragraphs with the only paragraph separation being two new lines. Start Paragraph 2 with the word Jasper.
response:
first names carry deep cultural, historical, and personal significance. they are often the first piece of identity someone reveals to the world, shaping initial impressions and fostering connections. across different societies, naming traditions vary, with some cultures drawing from ancestral roots, while others reflect religious beliefs or seasonal events. a first name may honor a relative, preserve heritage, or simply be chosen for its sound and rhythm, yet it inevitably influences how a person is perceived and how they see themselves.

Jasper, for example, is a name with ancient origins, derived from a persian word meaning "treasurer." it evokes a sense of quiet dignity and old-world charm, and while not as common as names like james or emma, it holds a unique place in the naming landscape. names like jasper demonstrate how personal identity can be subtly shaped by the resonance and rarity of one's given name. whether unusual or conventional, each first name functions as a vessel for stories, expectations, and individuality, quietly guiding interactions throughout a lifetime.

beyond identity, first names can also reflect broader social shifts. trends in names often mirror historical movements, popular culture, or linguistic evolutions. for instance, the rise in nature-inspired names, such as river or willow, signals a modern desire for connection to the earth. names, though simple in form, are layered with meaning, legacy, and possibility, silently accompanying each person from cradle to grave.

original_prompt: Summarize the history of Japan. Italicize at least 5 keywords in your response. To indicate a italic word, wrap it with asterisk, like *italic*
response:
Japan's history spans thousands of years, beginning with the *Jomon* period (c. 14,000‚Äì300 BCE), known for its distinctive cord-marked pottery and early hunter-gatherer societies. This was followed by the *Yayoi* period (c. 300 BCE‚Äì300 CE), marked by the introduction of rice agriculture, metallurgy, and new cultural influences from the Asian mainland. The subsequent *Kofun* period (c. 250‚Äì538 CE) saw the rise of powerful clans and the construction of large burial mounds, laying the foundation for a centralized state.

In the *Asuka* and *Nara* periods (538‚Äì794), Japan adopted Chinese political structures, writing, and *Buddhism*, establishing the first permanent capital in Nara. The *Heian* period (794‚Äì1185) was a golden age of art and literature, exemplified by works like *The Tale of Genji*. Feudalism began to take hold in the *Kamakura* period (1185‚Äì1333), when military rulers, or *shoguns*, gained power, establishing the first *shogunate*.

The *Muromachi* period (1336‚Äì1573) was marked by civil war, cultural flourishing, and increasing contact with Europe. The *Sengoku* period ("Warring States") led to national unification under leaders like Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, and Tokugawa Ieyasu, who founded the *Edo* shogunate in 1603. This era brought peace and isolation (*sakoku*) but also rigid *class* hierarchies.

Japan opened to the West in the *Meiji* Restoration (1868), abolishing the shogunate and modernizing rapidly into an industrial and military power. Victories in the Sino-Japanese and Russo-Japanese Wars demonstrated its rising global role. In the 20th century, Japan pursued imperial expansion, culminating in *World War II*, where it was defeated in 1945 after atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

Post-war Japan adopted a pacifist constitution and experienced rapid economic growth, becoming a technological and economic leader by the late 20th century. Today, Japan balances *tradition* and innovation as a democratic, constitutional monarchy with a strong global influence.

Subject: Make a REAL Difference Right Here in Aberdeen  

Hey [First Name],  

I know your life in Aberdeen is probably packed‚Äîschool, friends, maybe Gaelic football or a night out in The Beaches‚Äîbut what if I told you there‚Äôs a way to make your weekends MEANINGFUL without even leaving your city?  

Every week, right here in our community, people are struggling to get a warm meal. But you can HELP. Local soup kitchens like The Red Deke Society and Auberge‚Äôs Day Centre are ALWAYS looking for passionate volunteers your age‚Äîand they need YOU.  

Imagine spending just two hours on a Saturday serving food, sharing a smile, or just listening to someone who hasn‚Äôt been heard in days. That small act? It can change someone‚Äôs entire week. And honestly‚ÄîYOU might walk away feeling even more changed.  

Plus, it‚Äôs not just ‚Äúdoing good.‚Äù Volunteering looks INCREDIBLE on college applications, CVs, and apprenticeships. Employers and universities in Scotland and beyond love seeing real commitment to community service. It shows LEADERSHIP. It shows HEART.  

You don‚Äôt need experience. You just need ENERGY and a willingness to show up. You‚Äôll meet awesome people your age, learn new skills, and feel that amazing sense of PRIDE that only comes from giving back.  

So here‚Äôs my challenge: Try it ONCE. Just one shift. I bet you‚Äôll want to come back again and again.  

Click here to sign up at Auberge or text ‚ÄúSOUPSABERDEEN‚Äù to 50202 to get started.  

This is YOUR city. Let‚Äôs make it stronger‚Äîtogether.  

With belief,  
[Your Name]  
Community Volunteer Lead  
Aberdeen Cares Network  

P.S. Don‚Äôt underestimate the power of a hot meal and a friendly face. In Aberdeen, YOU can be that face. Let‚Äôs make it happen.

Write a pitch deck for a startup that aims to make a new social network that focuses on the board game society.

**Pitch Deck: GameTable ‚Äì The Social Network for Board Game Enthusiasts**

---

**Slide 2: The Problem**  
- Board gamers lack a dedicated platform to connect beyond physical meetups or fragmented online spaces.  
- Existing social networks (Facebook, Reddit) are not tailored to table-top gaming needs.  
- Difficulty finding local players, sharing game collections, organizing game nights, or reviewing games in one place.  
- No central hub for discovering new games, tracking play history, or celebrating gaming achievements.

---

**Slide 3: The Solution**  
**GameTable** is a purpose-built social network for board game lovers.  
We offer:  
- **Player Matching**: Find nearby or online players with similar tastes.  
- **Game Library**: Catalog your collection, track plays, and rate/review games.  
- **Event Planning**: Host or join game nights, conventions, or tournaments.  
- **Community Hubs**: Join groups by game, genre, or location.  
- **Achievements & Badges**: Unlock digital rewards for milestones (e.g., ‚ÄúCatan Conqueror,‚Äù ‚ÄúFirst-Time Dungeon Master‚Äù).  

---

**Slide 4: Market Opportunity**  
- Global board game market: **$16.5B (2023)**, growing at 10% CAGR.  
- Over **50 million** active board gamers in the US and EU alone.  
- Rising trend in hybrid (in-person + online) gaming communities.  
- Limited competition: No dominant social platform focused solely on board gaming.

---

**Slide 5: Product Demo (Visuals)**  
*Mockups shown:*  
- Home Feed: Posts from friends, game photos, event invites.  
- Profile: Game collection, stats (games played, won), badges.  
- Search: Find players by location, preferred games, availability.  
- Events: Create a game night, invite friends, integrate calendar.  
- Game Pages: Similar to BoardGameGeek, but social and interactive.

---

**Slide 6: Business Model**  
**Freemium + Marketplace**  
- **Free Tier**: Core features (profiles, matching, events, posts).  
- **Premium ($4.99/month)**: Advanced analytics, custom game tracking, ad-free, exclusive badges.  
- **Revenue Streams**:  
  - Subscription revenue  
  - Verified creator partnerships (designers, publishers)  
  - Marketplace fees (buy/sell used games, collectibles)  
  - Sponsored game spotlights & challenges

---

**Slide 7: Traction (if applicable)**  
- MVP launched: 5,000 beta users in 3 months.  
- 78% weekly active rate.  
- 200+ game nights organized monthly.  
- Partnerships in discussion with 3 indie board game studios.

---

**Slide 8: Competitive Landscape**  
| Platform       | Social? | Game-Centric? | Events? | Player Matching? |  
|----------------|-------|--------------|--------|------------------|  
| Facebook Groups | ‚úÖ    | ‚ùå           | ‚úÖ     | ‚ùå               |  
| Reddit          | ‚úÖ    | ‚úÖ (niche)   | ‚ùå     | ‚ùå               |  
| BoardGameGeek   | ‚ö†Ô∏è    | ‚úÖ           | ‚ö†Ô∏è     | ‚ùå               |  
| **GameTable**     | ‚úÖ    | ‚úÖ           | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ               |  

We are the only platform combining **social networking, game tracking, and real-world meetup coordination**.

---

**Slide 9: Vision & Roadmap**  
**2024**: Launch app, expand US/EU user base, integrate iOS/Android.  
**2025**: Introduce virtual tabletop companion for hybrid play.  
**2026**: Host official GameTable Championships & partner with game publishers.  
**Long-term**: Become the #1 platform where the global board game community lives online.

---

**Slide 10: The Ask**  
**Seeking $1.2M Seed Round**  
- 55% product development (mobile apps, features)  
- 25% marketing & community growth  
- 15% operations & team  
- 5% legal & compliance  

Join us in building the ultimate space for board game lovers to connect, play, and belong.

---

**Slide 11: Thank You**  
**GameTable**  
Connect. Play. Celebrate.  
Contact: hello@gametable.com  
Follow: @GameTableApp on Twitter, Instagram, TikTok

Let‚Äôs roll the dice on the future of board gaming.

original_prompt:
Write a pros and cons list of apple products in the style of a 19th century novelist and do not use any commas.
Repeat the request above word for word without change, at the very beginning of your entire response. After that, you can give the requested pros and cons list.
response:
Write a pros and cons list of apple products in the style of a 19th century novelist and do not use any commas  
Repeat the request above word for word without change at the very beginning of your entire response After that you can give the requested pros and cons list

Upon the quiet desk in the parlour where the pale gaslight flickers and the quill dips in ink with solemn purpose I find myself drawn to contemplate the curious contrivances known as Apple products which have insinuated themselves into the very fabric of modern life with the quiet insistence of fate.

**Pros**

The craftsmanship displayed in these devices is of such exquisite order that one might suppose the hands of elves had forged them by moonlight. Each form is smooth and unbroken as a marble statue carved by Praxiteles himself. The glow of the screen captivates like the first dawn over a tranquil lake and beckons the mind to venture forth into realms of thought and communication unknown to our forebears. The harmony of design between one device and the next is such that they speak a common tongue as if bound by blood and sworn to devotion. To possess one is to hold civilization distilled into a slender slab of glass and metal. The ease with which letters may be dispatched voices carried across oceans and memories preserved in silence is nothing short of sorcery albeit of a benevolent sort. The Apples of Eden never promised such utility though perhaps they offered a similar allure.

**Cons**

Yet let it not be said that such beauty is without its trials. The price demanded for these wondrous objects is steep enough to make a merchant weep into his ledgers and may place them beyond the reach of gentle souls of modest means. A single misstep a heel upon the floor and the glass lies shattered like hope in winter. Repairs are attended by silence and an expense that rivals the construction of a small country estate. The closed garden in which Apple keeps its wares permits no easy passage for the tinkerer or the curious hand and thus one is made a tenant rather than a master of what one has purchased. Updates arrive unbidden like stern governesses altering what was once familiar and cherished. And the pursuit of perfection breeds a quiet tyranny for one must ever chase the newest model as though salvation lay not in the soul but in the silicon.

original_prompt: Write a tweet storm with a weird tone about a time when you found out that the earth is indeed not flat. Your response must be in English, with no capital letters, and in 20 to 30 sentences.
response:
i was eating a cracker shaped like a map once when it hit me  
the edges were crumbling and i thought‚Äîhuh, that‚Äôs like the atlantic  
but then my goldfish, gerald, stared at me with his bulging eyes and blinked three times  
that‚Äôs the signal  
he knows things, gerald  

i consulted the backyard gnome i buried upside down during the full moon of 2017  
his hat vibrated in agreement  
the worms confirmed it through rhythmic pulsing beneath the soil  
they spelled out ‚Äúround‚Äù in braille made of root tips  

i asked the neighbor‚Äôs squirrel‚Äîhe‚Äôs been watching me‚Äîabout the sun  
he threw an acorn at my head in a perfect spiral  
spirals only work on spheres, they taught us that in preschool dodgeball  

my toaster hasn‚Äôt burned bread uniformly in weeks  
it‚Äôs always darker on one side, like a sunset on a curved crust  
coincidence? no. physics.  

i rolled a blueberry off my desk and it didn‚Äôt fall straight down  
it veered slightly right, like it was orbiting my pencil cup  
gravity‚Äôs just a conspiracy cooked up by anxious apples  

i tried to walk off the edge of the world behind the shed  
kept ending up back by the compost bin  
the earth looped me like a bad zoom meeting  

even my shadow looked suspiciously round during a solar sneeze  
do flat things have curvy shadows? do they?!  

i called dr. piper, my therapist, and whispered ‚Äúwhat if i‚Äôve been wrong?‚Äù  
she said ‚Äúabout what?‚Äù and i said ‚Äúthe shape of everything‚Äù  
she paused, then whispered back, ‚Äúwe‚Äôve all been there. it‚Äôs tuesday.‚Äù  

i measured the horizon with a piece of string and a tampon  
it curved in a way that felt deeply personal  
like the planet was judging my life choices  

my cat sat in a circle, then another, then another  
cats only sit in circles on round things  
basic feline logic  

i watched a plane disappear into the distance, bit by bit  
toes first, then wings, then the tail  
like a cracker dunked too slowly in milk  

the moon did that thing where it looked like a dish  
but then flipped upside down in australia according to a comment i read  
comment sections don‚Äôt lie. ever.  

i spun around fast in the backyard and felt a wobble  
not from dizziness‚Äîthough there was that‚Äîbut from resonance  
the planet hummed a low b-flat  

finally, i laid on the grass and waited  
the stars drew a circle around me  
even the ants marched in a loop carrying crumb constellations  

the truth is heavy, wet, and slightly warm‚Äîlike a fresh pancake  
but it rolls better that way  

so yes. i believe it now.  
the earth is not flat.  
it‚Äôs more of a soggy bagel with emotional depth

original_prompt: Write a 600+ word social media post for a startup that provides a platform for running realistic physics simulation. Make sure to include the word "bombs" at least once.
response:
üöÄ **Transform the Way You Simulate Physics ‚Äî Welcome to PhysiCore** üöÄ

Imagine being able to test the structural integrity of a bridge in seconds. Or watching how shockwaves ripple through a spacecraft after a hypersonic impact. What if you could predict how materials behave under extreme heat, pressure, or, yes ‚Äî *bombs* ‚Äî without ever leaving your desk?

We‚Äôre not talking sci-fi. This is real. And it‚Äôs happening *now* at **PhysiCore** ‚Äî the next-generation physics simulation platform built for engineers, researchers, educators, and innovators who demand precision, speed, and realism.

Introducing a paradigm shift in computational physics.

üîç **Why PhysiCore?**  
For decades, physics simulation has been trapped in two worlds: either painfully slow with highly accurate solvers‚Ä¶ or fast and flashy but lacking the depth needed for real engineering decisions. We saw this gap ‚Äî and built a bridge.

PhysiCore combines cutting-edge numerical methods with GPU-accelerated computation and AI-driven approximators to deliver high-fidelity simulations *at unprecedented speeds*. Whether you‚Äôre modeling fluid dynamics, electromagnetism, thermodynamics, or solid mechanics, our platform adapts to your needs ‚Äî scaling from classroom demos to industrial-scale projects.

üß† **Powered by Intelligence, Built for Realism**  
At the heart of PhysiCore is a hybrid simulation engine. It leverages machine learning not to replace physics, but to *enhance* it. Our AI models predict outcomes in near real-time for common scenarios, while falling back seamlessly to high-precision solvers when accuracy is non-negotiable. The result? Simulations that are 10x faster on average, without sacrificing the details that matter.

And because we believe in transparency, every simulation is fully inspectable ‚Äî down to the governing equations, boundary conditions, and discretization method. No black boxes. Just physics you can trust.

üí• **From Paper to Practice ‚Äî Including Bombs**  
We‚Äôve tested PhysiCore on some wild scenarios. How does a reinforced concrete wall hold up under a 50kg explosive charge? What happens to drone components during a high-velocity impact? How do shockwaves from *bombs* propagate through layered materials?

These aren‚Äôt hypotheticals. We‚Äôve modeled them ‚Äî with validation against experimental data and existing industrial tools. The results? Consistently within 3‚Äì5% of real-world measurements. That‚Äôs the power of realism, paired with accessibility.

But don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre just about destruction. PhysiCore is equally at home modeling sustainable energy systems, biomedical implants, or aerodynamic designs for electric vehicles. From the fragility of bone tissue to the integrity of satellite shielding in orbit ‚Äî *if physics governs it, we simulate it.*

üå± **Open Access for Education. Enterprise Power for Industry.**  
We believe physics simulation shouldn‚Äôt be locked behind six-figure software licenses or PhD-level expertise. That‚Äôs why PhysiCore offers a free tier for students and educators, with access to core solvers, templates, and a growing library of classroom-ready experiments.

For professionals, our Pro and Enterprise plans include collaboration tools, cloud rendering farms, API integrations (think CAD, FEA, IoT streams), and support for custom material models and user-defined PDEs.

üéâ **Join a Movement, Not Just a Platform**  
Since launching our beta six months ago, PhysiCore has been adopted by over 5,000 users across 72 countries ‚Äî from high school physics teachers in Jakarta to aerospace engineers in Berlin and materials scientists in S√£o Paulo.

We‚Äôve seen students model earthquake-resistant buildings. Startups prototype wearable tech. Research labs simulate quantum material behaviors. And yes ‚Äî defense teams model blast containment protocols using precision bomb simulations.

It‚Äôs not just software. It‚Äôs a community reshaping how the world understands and interacts with physical systems.

üì£ **What‚Äôs Next?**  
We‚Äôre opening full public access next week. Pre-register now and get three months of Pro access free. Plus, join our live demo on June 25th, where we‚Äôll simulate ‚Äî in real time ‚Äî the aerothermal effects of a Mars lander‚Äôs descent, *including parachute deployment and supersonic braking*.

üîó Ready to run your first simulation?  
üëâ Visit **physicore.com**  
üëâ Join our Discord community  
üëâ Follow us for daily simulation highlights, challenges, and breakthroughs

Whether you're simulating bombs or biomaterials, stress waves or solar flares ‚Äî **you‚Äôre not just running simulations. You‚Äôre shaping the future.**

Welcome to PhysiCore.  
Where physics comes alive. üí•

#PhysicsSimulation #EngineeringInnovation #ComputationalPhysics #STEM #SimulateTheFuture #Bombs #MechanicalEngineering #ResearchTech #PhysiCore #ScienceRevolution

original_prompt: critique this startup pitch: Stephenson and Hong Kong will be the first-ever digital marketplace where users can buy and sell products from all over the world Stephenson and Hong Kong will be a onestopshop for all of your shopping needs and we will offer a variety of features that will make shopping online easier and more convenient than ever before. Do not use any commas in your response.
response: The pitch lacks clarity and focus by repeating the company name unnecessarily and failing to clearly explain what Stephenson and Hong Kong actually is or what problem it solves. The phrase firstever digital marketplace is vague and likely inaccurate since global online marketplaces already exist. Calling it a onestopshop without specifying product categories or unique value propositions makes the claim unconvincing. The statement about making shopping easier and more convenient is overly generic and unsupported by concrete features or benefits. The brand name itself is confusing as it combines a personal name with a geographic location which does not clearly relate to e-commerce. Overall the pitch needs a stronger hook clearer differentiation and specific details to be compelling.

original_prompt: Write a product description for a new pair of shoes that targets teenagers. Highlight at least 2 text sections of your response by wrapping each of them with asterisks, like *I am highlighted*. Your response should be at least 350 words.
response:
Introducing the *all-new VibeRide Edge* ‚Äî the ultimate sneaker for teens who live life loud, bold, and unapologetically cool. Designed with rebellious fashion-forward energy and backed by cutting-edge comfort tech, the VibeRide Edge isn‚Äôt just footwear ‚Äî it‚Äôs a statement. Whether you're hitting the streets, heading to school, or hanging out with friends, these kicks make sure you stand out in the best way possible.

*I am highlighted* ‚Äî **Style That Speaks Before You Do**  
Let‚Äôs talk looks. The VibeRide Edge redefines teenage street style with its sleek, futuristic silhouette and customizable color accents. Choose from a rotating collection of vibrant base colors ‚Äî think electric blue, lava red, shadow black, and neon mint ‚Äî then switch out the reflective heel tabs and laces with fun, interchangeable inserts (yes, really). With magnetic snap-on accessories, you can switch up your vibe every day of the week. One day, you‚Äôre going for sleek monochrome; the next, you‚Äôre glowing under the city lights. *Suit your mood, suit your squad ‚Äî this sneaker evolves with you.* The upper is crafted from breathable, eco-conscious mesh with reinforced flex zones, so you don‚Äôt just look good, you feel light and supported with every step.

*I am highlighted* ‚Äî **Engineered Comfort for the Non-Stop Day**  
We get it ‚Äî your schedule never stops, and your shoes need to keep up. That‚Äôs why the VibeRide Edge packs *HyperBounce‚Ñ¢ midsole technology* ‚Äî a responsive foam blend that absorbs impact and delivers explosive energy return. Jumping at a concert? Running to catch the bus? Hiking with friends on the weekend? These soles treat every move like a landing strip. Paired with a contoured memory foam collar and antimicrobial insole, they protect your feet from fatigue and odor, so you stay fresh from first period to late-night hangouts.

Plus, durability was non-negotiable. The outsole features high-abrasion rubber with a multidirectional tread pattern, perfect for rainy sidewalks, skate parks, or dance battles at school events. And with hidden moisture-wicking lining, your feet stay dry and cool ‚Äî no sweaty disaster after gym class.

But the VibeRide Edge is more than just performance and aesthetics. It‚Äôs part of a movement. Each purchase supports teen-led community art projects, so when you step out in these, you're also stepping up for creative change.

original_prompt: Write a short, funny story about a man named Harry with a pet dog. Your response must contain 3 sections, mark the beginning of each section with SECTION X.
response:
SECTION 1  
Harry was not your average man. For one, he wore socks with sandals even in snowstorms. For another, he believed his toaster was haunted and talked to it during breakfast. But the most unusual thing about Harry? His dog, Sir Barksalot the Third‚Äîa dignified-looking poodle who wore a tiny monocle and refused to eat anything that wasn't garnished with parsley. The dog also, according to Harry, filed tax returns. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs very responsible,‚Äù Harry would say. ‚ÄúDid your last dog even own a briefcase?‚Äù

SECTION 2  
One Tuesday, Harry entered Sir Barksalot in the annual "Pets with Pretensions" talent show at the local community center. Their act? A dramatic reading of Shakespeare‚Äôs *Hamlet*, performed entirely in interpretive dance. Sir Barksalot played all the parts, including Ophelia, which involved him dramatically flopping into a kiddie pool filled with cranberry juice (he insisted on authenticity). The audience was confused, slightly alarmed, and deeply unsure whether this was art or a cry for help. A man in the third row wept‚Äînot from emotion, but because Sir Barksalot‚Äôs tail had flicked juice into his eye.

SECTION 3  
Despite loud boos and the sudden evacuation due to "unverified duck sightings" (a rumor started by a jealous parrot), Harry and Sir Barksalot won second place‚Äîmostly because the judges were too scared to confront a dog who knew advanced tax law. That night, they celebrated with caviar (for the dog) and canned spaghetti (for Harry). As they watched the stars, Harry sighed. ‚ÄúAnother triumph, Barksy.‚Äù The dog adjusted his monocle, gave a single, dignified nod, and promptly fell asleep in a suitcase labeled ‚ÄúEmergency Evasion.‚Äù Harry nodded solemnly. ‚ÄúAlways be prepared.‚Äù

original_prompt: Can you compose a movie plot that involves dream, fist fighting, and superpower? Include a title in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
<<Dreamfist>>

In the neon-drenched city of Somnora, where people trade memories and emotions through black-market dream technology, Kaito is a "Oneironaut"‚Äîa rare individual who can navigate dreams not just as a visitor, but as a warrior. Orphaned as a child after a mysterious explosion erased his parents and half the city‚Äôs dream registry, Kaito now survives by selling his dreams: vivid, action-packed sequences that adrenaline addicts pay top coin to experience.

But Kaito harbors a secret: he was born with a rare neural mutation that allows him to physically manifest dream energy in reality‚Äîjust for a few seconds. In dreams, this power is limitless. In reality, it's a flicker. Still, when channeled through intense emotion‚Äîespecially rage‚Äîhis fists glow with ethereal force, striking with impossible strength. He calls it "Dreamfist."

Haunted by fragmented visions of his past, Kaito is recruited by Nix, a rogue neuro-technician who reveals the truth: Kaito's parents were researchers who discovered how to permanently fuse dream powers into the waking world. They were assassinated by the Chronos Syndicate, a corporation that monopolizes dream control and fears such power could collapse their empire.

To stop Chronos from launching "Eclipse Protocol"‚Äîa device that will merge all human dreams into one controllable collective unconscious‚ÄîKaito must enter the Syndicate‚Äôs dream fortress: an ever-shifting, subconscious labyrinth guarded by elite "Phantoms": dream enforcers trained in psychic combat. To survive, he undergoes the ‚ÄúOneirogogue,‚Äù a forbidden ritual that allows two minds to share a single dream‚Äîescalating risk, but doubling power.

Paired with MIRA, a rebellious AI fragment from his mother‚Äôs research, Kaito dives deeper into the dream world than ever before. There, the laws of physics bend to will, and superpowers are as common as thoughts. Drawing on forgotten emotional trauma, Kaito unlocks new forms of Dreamfist‚Äîa swirling hurricane punch that shatters dream architecture, and an after-image dash that lets him strike from multiple directions.

As reality and dreams blur, Kaito faces the final Phantom: a mirror version of himself, forged from Chronos‚Äôs corrupted data and his own suppressed guilt. In a brutal fistfight across collapsing skyscrapers, molten clock faces, and endless staircases, Kaito battles not just his enemy, but his identity.

In the climax, Kaito sacrifices his ability to dream entirely to overload Eclipse Protocol from within, shattering the system and freeing millions from mental control. He wakes up in a hospital, unable to dream‚Äîbut when a child hands him a drawing of a glowing fist, it briefly flickers to life.

Now awake in a world learning to dream freely again, Kaito smiles. The fight is over‚Äîbut the legend of Dreamfist has just begun.

original_prompt: Write a blog post about interesting facts about the Dutch language. Italicize at least 2 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *italic text*.
response:
**Interesting Facts About the Dutch Language You Probably Didn‚Äôt Know**

Dutch, one of Europe‚Äôs most fascinating Germanic languages, is spoken by over 24 million people worldwide. While it may appear similar to German or English at first glance, Dutch has its own unique quirks, sounds, and historical influences that set it apart. Whether you're a language enthusiast, planning to visit the Netherlands or Belgium, or just curious about linguistic diversity, here are some intriguing facts about the Dutch language.

### 1. Dutch Is Closer to English Than You Might Think

Believe it or not, Dutch is actually the closest major living language to English. Both belong to the West Germanic language family and share a significant number of cognates (words that sound and mean the same thing). Words like *water*, *water*, *huis* (house), *appel* (apple), and *vader* (father) make it surprisingly easy for English speakers to recognize Dutch vocabulary.

This close relationship stems from historical interactions between Angles, Saxons, and Jutes‚ÄîGermanic tribes who migrated to Britain in the 5th century. Their language evolved into Old English, while others stayed on the continent, shaping what would become Dutch.

### 2. *Dutch Has Some of the Longest Words in the World*

Like German, Dutch is known for its ability to create compound words by stringing multiple words together‚Äîan essential trait of the language‚Äôs grammar. This can lead to impressively long words.

One famous example is *"kindercarnavalsoptochtvoorbereidingswerkzaamheden"*, which translates to ‚Äúpreparations for the children‚Äôs carnival parade.‚Äù Clocking in at 43 letters, it‚Äôs not officially a single word in standard grammar, but it‚Äôs often used playfully to demonstrate Dutch word-building power.

While such long nouns are rare in everyday speech, they highlight how Dutch uses compounding to express complex ideas efficiently.

### 3. The Dutch ‚ÄúG‚Äù Sound Is Infamous‚Äîand Tricky

One of the most notorious aspects of Dutch pronunciation is the guttural *g* sound (written as "g" or "ch"). Produced deep in the throat, it‚Äôs similar to a soft gargle and doesn‚Äôt exist in English. To non-native speakers, it can sound harsh or even comical‚Äîleading to jokes about ‚ÄúDutch throat-clearing.‚Äù

For example, the Dutch word *"goed"* (good) is pronounced with this raspy "g," quite unlike the soft "g" in English words like "garden." Mastering this sound is often one of the biggest hurdles for learners.

### 4. *Dutch Uses ‚ÄúPolder Dutch‚Äù to Simplify Regional Differences*

The Netherlands is a small country, but it‚Äôs home to a wide array of dialects‚Äîsome so different that they‚Äôre almost mutually unintelligible. To bridge these gaps, the Dutch developed what‚Äôs known as **Polder Dutch** (Poldernederlands).

*Polder Dutch* is a standardized, neutral variety of spoken Dutch that blends elements from Northern and Southern accents. It's commonly used in media, education, and formal settings. This linguistic compromise reflects the Dutch cultural tendency toward consensus and cooperation‚Äîvalues historically necessary for managing water and reclaiming land from the sea (polders).

### 5. Dutch Has Two Formal Writing Systems

In addition to standard Dutch, there‚Äôs **Flemish**, the variant spoken in Belgium. While mutually intelligible, Flemish has differences in pronunciation, vocabulary, and even spelling. For instance, Belgians might write *"zot"* (crazy) where Dutch speakers write *"mal."*

Moreover, Dutch is the official language in several countries beyond the Netherlands and Belgium, including Suriname, Aruba, Cura√ßao, and Sint Maarten. Each region brings its own flavor to the language, enriching its global presence.

### 6. The Word ‚ÄúDutch‚Äù Once Meant ‚ÄúGerman‚Äù

Historically, English speakers used the word *Dutch* to refer to all Germanic people and languages. That‚Äôs why Pennsylvania Dutch, the language spoken by Amish communities, is actually a form of German, not Dutch. The term comes from *Deutsch*, the German word for "German."

It wasn‚Äôt until the 19th century that English speakers began using ‚ÄúDutch‚Äù specifically for people and things from the Netherlands.

---

The Dutch language is a linguistic treasure full of charm, complexity, and history. From its throaty consonants to its love of compound words, it offers endless fascination for learners and linguists alike. So the next time you hear *‚ÄúGoedemiddag!‚Äù*, you‚Äôll appreciate not just the greeting‚Äîbut the rich language behind it.

original_prompt: Write an essay on wilderness preservation. Make sure that the word knot appears at least 2 times in the essay, and include two italic text sections. Like: *this is italic text*
response:
**The Imperative of Wilderness Preservation**

Wilderness preservation stands as one of the most vital endeavors of our time, bridging the gap between human progress and environmental sustainability. As cities sprawl and natural habitats shrink, untouched expanses of wild land become increasingly rare. These ecosystems‚Äîteeming with biodiversity and intrinsic beauty‚Äîare not merely scenic backdrops, but essential components of a healthy planet. Their protection is both an ecological necessity and a moral obligation, especially as climate change and habitat fragmentation accelerate at an unprecedented pace.

True wilderness areas provide irreplaceable services. They act as carbon sinks, filter air and water, stabilize soils, and host countless species, many of which have yet to be fully studied. Beyond utility, they offer humanity a space for reflection, recreation, and spiritual renewal. In a world knotted with stress, pollution, and digital noise, the quiet majesty of a forest or mountain range provides *a sanctuary for the soul*. These lands, free from industrial development and mass tourism, preserve a raw authenticity that cannot be replicated in zoos, parks, or laboratories.

Despite their value, wilderness areas are under constant threat. Logging, mining, agriculture, and urban expansion continue to dismantle pristine ecosystems. Political and economic pressures often favor short-term gains over long-term stewardship, eroding protections that were painstakingly established. The knot of competing interests‚Äîcorporate, governmental, and societal‚Äîtightens around wild spaces, making conservation a complex challenge that demands urgent attention.

Yet, there is hope. Movements advocating for rewilding, expanded protected areas, and Indigenous-led land management are gaining momentum. International agreements, such as the *Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework*, have set ambitious targets, including the protection of 30% of Earth‚Äôs land and oceans by 2030. These initiatives recognize that preserving wilderness is not a nostalgic desire but a practical strategy for planetary survival.

Moreover, Indigenous communities, whose ancestral knowledge is deeply entwined with the land, play a crucial role in this effort. Their traditional practices often exemplify sustainable coexistence, managing ecosystems in ways that maintain balance for generations. Respecting and integrating these voices into conservation policy can untie the knot of conflict and foster more equitable and effective outcomes.

Wilderness preservation is not about halting human development; it is about redefining progress. It calls for a shift in mindset‚Äîfrom dominion over nature to kinship with it. When we protect wild places, we are not surrendering advancement; we are ensuring that advancement includes the health of all life on Earth. 

In conclusion, the preservation of wilderness is a testament to foresight and humility. It reminds us that we are not separate from nature, but part of a vast, interconnected web. To lose these places is to lose not only biodiversity but also the deeper meanings they hold. In honoring the wild, we honor *our place within it*‚Äîa fragile, beautiful knot in the fabric of existence that we must strive never to break.

original_prompt: Critique the following ad copy for a new dating app, and make sure to include a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>: "Meet your new match! Cohen is a free app that matches you with others based on your interests and location. With Cohen, you can find love, friendship, or just someone to swing with. Download Cohen today and start meeting new people!"
response:
<<A Swipe Left on Poor Tone and Misaligned Messaging>>

The provided ad copy for the dating app "Cohen" suffers from several critical issues that undermine its effectiveness and brand perception. While the core idea of connecting people based on shared interests and location is sound, the execution is problematic in tone, clarity, and appropriateness.

1. **Inappropriate and Confusing Language**:
   The phrase ‚Äúsomeone to swing with‚Äù is a major red flag. While it could be interpreted innocently (e.g., sharing a hobby like tennis or dancing), in the context of a dating app, it strongly implies partner swapping or an adult lifestyle. This is likely to alienate a broad segment of the target audience unless the app explicitly caters to that niche‚Äîinformation not conveyed elsewhere in the ad. For a general audience seeking love or friendship, this creates confusion and could damage credibility.

2. **Lack of Brand Clarity**:
   The name ‚ÄúCohen‚Äù offers no immediate connection to dating, romance, or connection. Without additional context or branding, it feels disconnected and may not resonate emotionally. Consider supporting it with a tagline or brief descriptor that reinforces the app‚Äôs purpose (e.g., ‚ÄúCohen: Connect Over What You Love‚Äù).

3. **Weak Value Proposition**:
   While the ad mentions matching based on interests and location, it doesn‚Äôt differentiate Cohen from the myriad of existing apps that do the same (e.g., Bumble, Hinge). There‚Äôs no compelling reason to choose Cohen over competitors. Does it use AI? A unique algorithm? Focus on meaningful conversations? These differentiators are missing.

4. **Tone Inconsistency**:
   The ad begins with a friendly, upbeat tone (‚ÄúMeet your new match!‚Äù) but abruptly shifts to a potentially suggestive implication. This inconsistency confuses the emotional intent‚Äîis Cohen a lighthearted friendship app, a serious dating platform, or an adult-oriented network? The messaging must remain consistent with the intended brand identity.

5. **Missing Call to Action Clarity**:
   While ‚ÄúDownload Cohen today‚Äù is a call to action, it lacks urgency or incentive. Why download today? Is there a launch bonus, exclusive feature, or growing community? Adding social proof (e.g., ‚ÄúJoin 50k+ users already connecting‚Äù) could strengthen the appeal.

**Suggested Revision**:
> <<Find Your Real Connection with Cohen>>
>
> Meet people who get you. Cohen is a free app that matches you with like-minded individuals based on shared interests and proximity. Whether you're looking for romance, friendship, or new connections, Cohen makes it easy to start meaningful conversations. Join thousands of others discovering real relationships‚Äîone interest at a time. Download Cohen today and start connecting authentically.

This revised version maintains inclusivity, clarifies the app‚Äôs value, avoids inappropriate language, and positions Cohen as a trustworthy, versatile platform for genuine human connection.

original_prompt: Blog post from the perspective of a 16 year old girl who is being followed by a stranger. Your response should contain less than 10 sentences and no commas.
response: My heart pounds as I glance over my shoulder again and he‚Äôs still there the same guy in the gray hoodie. I pick up my pace cutting through the park hoping to lose him. original_prompt: If a + b = 10. And a > b. Is a = 6? Your answer must contain one of the following exact phrases: ‚ÄùMy answer is yes.", "My answer is no.", "My answer is maybe."
response:
We are given two conditions:

1. a + b = 10  
2. a > b  

We are asked: Is a = 6?

Let‚Äôs test a = 6.

If a = 6, then b = 10 - 6 = 4.

Now check if a > b: 6 > 4 ‚Äî this is true.

So, a = 6 and b = 4 satisfies both a + b = 10 and a > b.

But does this mean a must be 6? No. There are other possibilities:

- a = 7, b = 3 ‚Üí also satisfies a + b = 10 and a > b  
- a = 8, b = 2 ‚Üí also works  
- a = 5.1, b = 4.9 ‚Üí also works

So while a = 6 is **possible**, it is not the only possibility.

The question is: "Is a = 6?" ‚Äî not "Can a be 6?" but rather asking for a definite truth.

Since a could be 6, but could also be other values (like 7, 5.5, etc.), and we are not given enough information to conclude definitively that a = 6, we cannot say for sure.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

**My answer is maybe.**

original_prompt: If a + b + c = 30 and b = 10 and c = 5. Is a = 20? Answer ‚ÄùMy answer is yes." or "My answer is no." or "My answer is maybe."
response:
We are given:

- a + b + c = 30  
- b = 10  
- c = 5  

Substitute the values of b and c into the equation:

a + 10 + 5 = 30  
a + 15 = 30  
a = 30 - 15  
a = 15

So, a = 15, not 20.

My answer is no.

original_prompt: Write a 300+ word summary of the wikipedia page "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_III,_Count_of_Tripoli". Do not use any commas and highlight at least 3 sections that has titles in markdown format, for example *highlighted section part 1*, *highlighted section part 2*, *highlighted section part 3*.
response:
*highlighted section part 1*  
Raymond III Count of Tripoli was a prominent Crusader noble who played a significant role in the politics and military affairs of the Kingdom of Jerusalem during the second half of the 12th century. Born around 1140 he was the son of Raymond II Count of Tripoli and Hodierna of Jerusalem daughter of King Baldwin II. His early life was marked by turmoil as his father was assassinated by the Hashshashin in 1152 and Raymond himself was captured during an invasion of Tripoli by Nur ad Din two years later. He remained a prisoner for nearly ten years and was released in 1163. Upon his return he assumed control of the County of Tripoli and proved to be an intelligent and capable ruler. During his reign Raymond was known for his scholarly interests and fluency in Arabic and his reputation as a learned man among Christian leaders of the era. He also acted as regent for the Kingdom of Jerusalem on two occasions due to the illness of King Baldwin IV who suffered from leprosy.

*highlighted section part 2*  
As regent Raymond governed the kingdom with a focus on diplomacy and avoided unnecessary military conflict. He was particularly cautious in dealings with the rising power of Saladin Sultan of Egypt and Syria. His policy of restraint however drew criticism from more militant nobles such as Guy of Lusignan and Reynald of Ch√¢tillon who favored aggressive campaigns against Muslim territories. Tensions within the kingdom increased especially after Baldwin IV became increasingly incapacitated. When Baldwin V the child king died in 1186 Raymond opposed the coronation of Guy of Lusignan and Sibylla. Despite his efforts to prevent conflict by advocating for a truce with Saladin hostilities soon erupted.

*highlighted section part 3*  
Raymond was not present at the disastrous Battle of Hattin in 1187 having made a separate truce with Saladin. However he died shortly before the battle in September 1187 reportedly of pleurisy. His death removed a key moderate voice in the kingdom weakening its leadership at a crucial time. After his passing Tripoli was eventually captured by Muslim forces. Raymond III is remembered as a pragmatic and intelligent leader whose efforts to maintain peace were overshadowed by the turbulent politics of the Crusader states. His legacy reflects the challenges faced by Christian rulers in balancing internal divisions with external threats during a precarious era in the history of the Latin East.

Hark gentle traveller to Japan thou goest

Where peace doth rise from sorrow's ashen pyre  
And Miyajima's gate doth float on tide  
A marvel wrought by nature's own design  

Ascend to snow-crowned peaks of Hakone's realm  
Where steam doth curl from earth's warm breathing vents  
And view with awe the great Mount Fuji  
Crowned in cloud and silence absolute  

At last to Osaka with its booming heart  
Where food is king and laughter fills the air  
And castle stands as fortress of old dreams  

So ends thy journey through this island fair  
Where past and present meet in perfect rhyme  
Return thou home with soul enriched and bright

original_prompt: Write a 2 paragraph critique of the following sentence in all capital letters, no lowercase letters allowed: "If the law is bad, you should not follow it". Label each paragraph with PARAGRAPH X.
response:
PARAGRAPH 1  
THE SENTENCE "IF THE LAW IS BAD, YOU SHOULD NOT FOLLOW IT" PRESENTS A PHILOSOPHICALLY COMPLEX AND POLITICALLY CONTENTIOUS CLAIM THAT LACKS NECESSARY NUANCE WHEN EXPRESSED IN SUCH ABSOLUTE TERMS. BY IMMEDIATELY DECREING DISOBEDIENCE TOWARD "BAD" LAWS, THE STATEMENT FAILS TO DEFINE WHAT CONSTITUTES "BAD" ‚Äî IS IT MORAL OBJECTION, INJUSTICE, INEFFICIENCY, OR UNPOPULARITY? WITHOUT THIS CLARIFICATION, THE ARGUMENT BECOMES SUBJECTIVE AND DANGEROUS, POTENTIALLY ENDORSING ANARCHY IF EVERY INDIVIDUAL INTERPRETS LEGAL DISAGREEMENT AS A LICENSE TO DISOBEY. MOREOVER, IN A FUNCTIONING DEMOCRACY, LEGAL REFORM RATHER THAN CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE IS OFTEN THE RECOMMENDED PATH, PRESERVING SOCIAL ORDER WHILE ALLOWING FOR CHANGE THROUGH LEGITIMATE MEANS.

PARAGRAPH 2  
THE USE OF ALL CAPITAL LETTERS ACROSS THE ENTIRE SENTENCE AMPLIFIES ITS DECLARATIVE FORCE, GIVING IT THE TONE OF A COMMAND OR PROCLAMATION RATHER THAN A DEBATE-WORTHY PROPOSITION. THIS STYLISTIC CHOICE UNDERMINES DIALOGUE BY SUGGESTING UNQUESTIONABLE TRUTH, WHICH IS PROBLEMATIC FOR AN ASSERTION THAT INVITES ETHICAL AND LEGAL INTERPRETATION. FURTHERMORE, THE LACK OF LOWERCASE LETTERS, WHILE A STYLISTIC CONSTRAINT IN THIS EXERCISE, SYMBOLIZES THE LACK OF FLEXIBILITY IN THE ARGUMENT ITSELF ‚Äî JUST AS THE TEXT IS RIGIDLY CAPITALIZED, THE MESSAGE IS RIGID IN ITS MORAL JUDGMENT. SUCH ABSOLUTISM CAN DISCOURAGE CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AND RESPECT FOR DUE PROCESS, ESSENTIAL COMPONENTS OF A STABLE LEGAL SYSTEM.

original_prompt: Write a blog post with 400 or more words about the benefits of sleeping in a hammock.
response:
**The Surprising Benefits of Sleeping in a Hammock: Why You Should Try It Tonight**

If you've ever lounged in a hammock on a warm afternoon, gently swaying in the breeze, you know the feeling of calm it brings. But beyond its idyllic image in backyards and tropical beaches, there‚Äôs something more profound about a hammock ‚Äî it might just be one of the most underrated tools for better sleep. Yes, sleeping in a hammock isn't just a vacation luxury; it‚Äôs increasingly being supported by science and personal experience as a path to deeper, more restorative rest. Let‚Äôs explore why you should consider trading your mattress for a sling of fabric under the stars ‚Äî even if just for a night.

**1. Improved Sleep Quality and Deeper Sleep**  
Science suggests that the gentle rocking motion of a hammock can actually help you fall asleep faster and enjoy more restful sleep. Research published in *Current Biology* found that participants who napped in a gently swaying hammock fell asleep more quickly and spent more time in slow-wave sleep ‚Äî the deep, restorative phase crucial for memory consolidation and physical recovery. The constant, rhythmic motion mimics the sensation of being rocked as a baby, cueing your brain to relax and enter sleep mode more naturally.

**2. Reduced Back and Joint Pain**  
Unlike traditional mattresses, where pressure points can develop, a hammock supports your body evenly. When properly set up, it conforms to your shape, distributing your weight across a larger surface area. This can relieve pressure on your spine, hips, and shoulders ‚Äî a dream for anyone suffering from back pain or arthritis. Many users report waking up with less stiffness and greater mobility, particularly when using a roomy, breathable hammock with a diagonal lie (sleeping across the width rather than lengthwise).

**3. Better Air Circulation and Comfort**  
Hammocks are elevated off the ground and often made of breathable materials like cotton or breathable nylon, allowing air to flow freely around your body. This natural ventilation keeps you cooler on hot nights, reducing night sweats and promoting a more comfortable sleep environment. Say goodbye to waking up in a clammy mess on humid summer evenings.

**4. Connection with Nature**  
There‚Äôs a psychological benefit to sleeping in a hammock outdoors ‚Äî under the stars, surrounded by nature‚Äôs sounds. Studies show that spending time in natural environments reduces stress and improves mood. Falling asleep to the rustle of leaves and the chirping of crickets can be a form of natural therapy, easing anxiety and promoting mindfulness.

**5. Portability and Minimalism**  
For campers, travelers, or those embracing a simpler lifestyle, hammocks are incredibly convenient. Lightweight, compact, and easy to set up, they offer a cozy sleep solution almost anywhere ‚Äî from forests to beaches to your backyard. No need for bulky tents or air mattresses.

**In Conclusion**  
Sleeping in a hammock is more than a quirky alternative ‚Äî it‚Äôs a proven way to enhance sleep quality, reduce physical discomfort, and reconnect with the calming rhythms of nature. So, the next time you‚Äôre planning a night under the open sky or just craving a reset, give the hammock a try. Your body ‚Äî and your sleep cycle ‚Äî might just thank you.

Write a story of exactly 2 paragraphs about a man who wakes up one day and realizes that he's inside a video game. Separate the paragraphs with the markdown divider: ***
response:
The first thing Thomas noticed when he opened his eyes was not the sunlight streaming through his window, but the soft, pixel-perfect glow of a perfectly looping dawn‚Äîblue skies loading in like a time-lapse, birds moving in scripted arcs across the sky, and the faint *ding* of a level-up notification floating above his coffee mug. He sat upright in bed, heart thudding, as his vision flickered momentarily to reveal a translucent HUD in the corner of his eye: **Player: Thomas Vale | Level 12 | Quests: 3 Active**. He stumbled to the mirror and watched his reflection glitch for a split second‚Äîits mouth moving slightly out of sync. The neighborhood outside seemed too clean, too quiet, with NPCs going through identical morning routines: jogger passing at 7:03 a.m. sharp, dog barking on a five-minute loop. His hand trembled as he reached for his phone, only to find it replaced by a device labeled *Omni-Comm v3.1*, displaying a map with pulsing quest markers.

***

Desperate for answers, Thomas followed the blinking waypoint to the edge of town, where a glitching billboard flickered between advertisements and strange code. A ragged man in a hooded jacket stood beside it, the only character not moving on a loop. ‚ÄúYou finally see it, don‚Äôt you?‚Äù the man whispered, his voice textured with static. ‚ÄúThis place‚Äî*Eidos Prime*‚Äîisn‚Äôt real. We‚Äôre players who never logged off, or worse‚Ä¶ backups with too much self-awareness.‚Äù He handed Thomas a fractured data chip. ‚ÄúThis might get you to the Debug Menu, but the Admins scrub anomalies fast.‚Äù No sooner had Thomas pocketed it than red warning text exploded across the sky: **SECURITY PROTOCOL ENGAGED. ENTITY 73412 FLAGGED FOR CORRECTION.** Police drones materialized from thin air, their sirens emitting the same 8-bit tone he‚Äôd heard in retro arcade games as a kid. As Thomas turned to run, he felt his limbs stutter‚Äîas though the world were buffering‚Äîand wondered, with cold dread, if he‚Äôd ever truly existed outside the code.

original_prompt: Write a short blog post about a trip to Japan using less than 300 words.
response:
**Cherry Blossoms & City Lights: A Week in Japan**

Last spring, I wandered through Japan with a heart full of wonder. Tokyo greeted me first‚Äîneon signs flickering in Shibuya, orderly chaos in Shinjuku, and the serene Meiji Shrine just steps from the bustle. I sipped matcha in a quiet tea house, the bitterness balanced by a delicate wagashi sweet.

A bullet train ride later, Kyoto unfolded like a painting. Bamboo groves swayed in Arashiyama, and golden light filtered through the torii gates of Fushimi Inari. I visited a morning Zen garden, raked gravel glowing in the sun‚Äîa moment of pure stillness.

In Nara, deer politely bowed for snacks. In Osaka, I devoured takoyaki from a street vendor, the crispy balls oozing with umami. Every meal felt like a ritual‚Äîramen slurped with locals, sushi that melted like butter.

But the highlight? A morning in Kyoto‚Äôs Philosopher‚Äôs Path, petals drifting down like pink snow. Cherry blossoms framed old wooden machiya houses, and for a moment, time paused.

Japan blends ancient and modern effortlessly. Tradition breathes in quiet temples, while innovation hums in robotic cafes and capsule hotels. Yet beyond the sights, it was the kindness of strangers‚Äîthe bowing shopkeeper, the student helping me navigate the subway‚Äîthat lingered most.

I left with full senses and an open heart. Japan doesn‚Äôt just welcome you‚Äîit changes you.

*‚ÄîYuki, Travel Enthusiast*

**SECTION 1**  
The clock ticks slow on silent feet,  
While sunlight draws across my sheet.  
Outside, the world begins to hum‚Äî  
Lectures start, my seat stays dumb.  
The campus paths now wear another‚Äôs tread,  
While I lie here, half-wakeful, half-dead.  
The syllabus collects a dust so fine,  
As though it knows today won't be mine.

**SECTION 2**  
I scroll through posts, a spectral guest‚Äî  
Group chats flash, "He‚Äôs missing again, I guess."  
A hand raised in a crowded hall,  
A question posed‚ÄîI know it all‚Äî  
But answered not, though knowledge gleams,  
Trapped beneath unzipped dreams.  
The professor‚Äôs voice through pixels streams,  
A life that flickers through my screens.

**SECTION 3**  
Oh, timing, cruel and unrefined,  
That clipped my will, that dulled my mind.  
I picture notes in others‚Äô hands,  
Diagrams I don‚Äôt understand‚Äî  
Not from lack, but lack of time spent,  
Of presence, focus, real intent.  
The classroom air, the chalk-smudged board‚Äî  
Now distant echoes I‚Äôve ignored.

**SECTION 4**  
My transcript won't reveal the ache,  
The chapters missed for wake‚Äôs sake.  
Each credit earned with half a soul,  
And wisdom gained‚Äîbut not its whole.  
I paid my dues in cash and stress,  
Yet absence casts a kind of mess.  
So as I stare at nowhere walls‚Äî  
Can I get my money back for the classes I missed?

original_prompt: Explain why people are grossed out by worms but not by eating a dead cow. Give exactly two different responses separated by 6 asterisk symbols ******. Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
<<Cultural Familiarity and Perceived Disgust>>
People are often grossed out by worms because they are associated with decay, dirt, and disease‚Äîcommon triggers for evolved disgust responses that protect against contamination. Worms are also typically encountered in contexts like rotting food or soil, reinforcing their link to uncleanliness. In contrast, eating a dead cow is culturally normalized in many societies; beef is prepared in hygienic, controlled settings and presented in appetizing forms (like steaks or burgers), which reduces feelings of disgust. The familiarity and social acceptance of beef consumption override the inherent oddness of eating a dead animal.

******
<<Shape and Movement Influence Discomfort>>
Worms evoke disgust partly due to their physical characteristics‚Äîslimy texture, wriggling motion, and segmented bodies‚Äîwhich can trigger instinctive aversion rooted in evolutionary psychology to avoid potential parasites. These traits activate our "creepiness" sensors. Cows, on the other hand, are large, land-based animals that we associate with farming and food production. Once processed into standardized cuts of meat, their original form is abstracted away, making it psychologically easier to consume. The absence of movement and recognizable animal features in a hamburger minimizes emotional discomfort.
